title: Side-effect ledger
description: Append-only, per-action side-effect ledger used for deterministic recovery, reporting, and post-mortem analysis when a run aborts mid-action.
$comment: Normative semantics (append-only, write-ahead flush, stable ordering, and lifecycle attribution) are specified in docs/spec/025_data_contracts.md. JSON Schema cannot fully enforce monotonic seq increments or crash-safe append behavior; CI MUST validate those invariants.

run_id.description: Run identifier for the run bundle containing this artifact.

action_id.description: Action identifier for the action whose side effects are recorded by this ledger.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of the last successful append to the ledger.

withheld.description: When true, this file is a deterministic placeholder and does not contain the unredacted ledger content.

withheld_reason_code.description: Machine-readable reason code for withholding (for example: post_check_match_after_redaction).

quarantine_path.description: Relative path (within the run bundle or configured quarantine root) where the quarantined unredacted ledger content was stored, when quarantining is enabled.

redaction_policy_id.description: Effective redaction policy identifier applied to this artifact.

redaction_policy_version.description: Effective redaction policy version applied to this artifact.

redaction_policy_sha256.description: SHA-256 hex of canonical JSON (RFC 8785 / JCS) for the effective redaction policy snapshot.

entries.description: Ordered ledger entries. Order is authoritative and MUST follow seq ascending with no gaps.

seq.description: Monotonic sequence number starting at 1. Stable ordering key for entries.

ts.description: Timestamp recorded for the entry (informational; ordering is defined by seq).

phase.description: Lifecycle phase to which this side effect is attributable.

effect_type.description: Stable classifier for the kind of side effect (for example: marker_emission, cleanup_verification, declared_effect).

disposition.description: Outcome classification for the side effect at the time the entry was appended.

observed.description: When false, the entry represents a declared or inferred effect (not directly observed).

summary.description: Human-readable summary suitable for reports (subject to redaction policy).

target.description: Optional target identifier for the mutated/emitted entity.

namespace.description: Scope namespace (for example: local, runner, windows, aws, azure).

type.description: Target type token (for example: file, registry_key, process, cloud_resource).

id.description: Target identifier (path, ARN, URL, GUID, etc.).

refs.description: Optional machine-readable references (for example: check_id, marker_id, artifact_path).

details.description: Optional structured details. Implementations MUST treat string values as subject to redaction policy.
